name: The Driskill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for a Thursday and Friday night in late May. After reading so many negative reviews about people not happy with their room we called the hotel directly to tell them exactly what we did, and didn't want. They were very understanding and room 545 worked well for us. Not huge, but not too small either. Had a king bed, table and chair and a loveseat. Only 1 robe though which seemed odd. Bathroom was good sized with good water pressure from the shower. The public areas are beautiful. Bar is very nice and drinks were reasonably priced. No street noise from our room. Rate was $329 before taxes and $34 per night for parking. I think at those rates there should be a newspaper outside the room in the morning and turndown service in the evening and they aren't. Complimentary wifi in the room didn't really work at all. If you like historic hotels and tell them what you do and don't want in your room you should be fine. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Great location.
reviews.title: Room 545

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to Austin several times, we had been to the Driskill bar and I knew I wanted to stay here at some point. Such a great historical hotel, great location! We finally had a weekend away and knew this was where we wanted to go. We booked a nicer than normal room to treat ourselves.
reviews.title: Lacking at every turn...

reviews.text: We knew we were going to be arriving late and called the hotel to let them know. We pulled up to the hotel (valet only) and were told to leave our car basically in the middle of the street. The valet was backed up, but leaving it on a busy street did not seem acceptable so we waited for a space to clear.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel on 6th Street!

reviews.text: When we went to check in, we confirmed that we would have a "Senate" room - oversized, spacious work desk, comfortable seating area etc. When we arrived to our room, it was TINY. There was no desk, one chair that wasn't comfortable - I felt like crying. This was supposed to be a special weekend away and the room was awful. We called the front desk and asked if there were other rooms Senate or not that they could move us to. There were not. We asked the bellman when he brought our luggage if it was indeed a Senate room and he confirmed as well. He did bring us a certificate for one breakfast in the morning (one? there were two of us in the room). We immediately started researching other hotels in the area to stay the rest of our trip.
reviews.title: Great location and service!

reviews.text: The next morning, we went down to check again. We were again told it was a Senate room even though there wasn't a desk etc... We asked to be moved to another room. While we were waiting for that room we thought we would go for a bike ride, one of the many things they offer for recreation. The concierge looked at his co-worker with a worried look and said that he would go check the bikes, that they had just been serviced. He came back about 15 minutes later and said we were good to go, but that they did not have a bike lock. He offered to give us $20 for us to stop while were were out and buy one (really??). We hopped on the bikes, excited to go explore. We turned the corner and tried to stop - NO BRAKES! We have similar bikes at home and ride frequently, we knew what we were doing. One of the scariest moments of my life. I had to ride into a curb and jump off to stop. After walking the bikes back we checked in with the concierge to let them know their bikes were indeed not fixed. While there, we were told that we had in fact not been in a Senate room all along and they were working on getting our new room set up.
reviews.title: Not a great experience

reviews.text: All in all, a decent experience but I would not write home about it. The location is convenient in downtown Austin & the front desk and concierge/service was excellent.
reviews.title: Nice if you want a historical feel, generally fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pros -- architecture & historical feel are top notch and really interesting. Definitely unique. Location. Sleep quality -- the bed was quite comfortable. Lobby area is also quite lovely.
reviews.title: Worth the expense

reviews.text: The cons -- the room (carpet, wallpaper, etc) was rather dated and the bathroom was probably from the 80's. Shower seemed quite old along with the tile. Generally clean, but not confidence-inducing by any means.
reviews.title: Very nice! Historic and interesting!

reviews.text: You also need to walk up two sets of stairs to get to the elevators, which is not a huge deal unless you are hauling big suitcases, which would then be irritating. Elevators also were small/old/slow.
reviews.title: The Ghost of Colonel Driskill

reviews.text: Multiple restaurants -- though I only went to the 1886 Cafe, which was good. I also enjoyed the live music in the bar, which made for a nice atmosphere, but not overly noisy either.
reviews.title: Our favorite place in Austin used to be so lovely! Won't be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We try to stay at the most historic hotels when traveling and The Driskill is certainly that for Austin! The pluses, The lobby is gorgeous and the location is great, and the bar is a must!
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful lobby, needs some work...
Horrible Reservations
reviews.text: The rooms are certainly on the smaller side which can be expected in a historic hotel but our room smelled musty and could certainly use some upgrading and the bathroom needed better ventilation, as the entire room felt like a sauna after every shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of our biggest disappointments was the staff. The front desk first checked us into a room that was in the actual vestibule area of the elevator even though other rooms were available so we had to head back to request a different room by cutting thru a wedding party to access the lobby.
reviews.title: Texas, just Texas!

reviews.text: The concierge however was even worse. We found them to be unhelpful, she was happy to sit and chat with us but gave us a lot of bad information. We had planned ahead and ran some things by her and she gave us a ton of misinformation. We'd like to see the bats we say, and she tells us this is not the time of year... Well luckily we followed up elsewhere because it most certainly was the time of year. We would like to do a cruise on the Lake, and were told these weren't running but could possibly charter our own boat. Checked ourselves and sure enough the boat cruises were running. I could go on but I'm sure you all get what I am saying.
reviews.title: Best Happy Hour in Austin

reviews.text: For a high end hotel I would certainly expect much more in the service department!
reviews.title: historic hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently (4/27/13) stayed in the Brazos Suite after our local wedding ceremony and reception. Our stay was delightful. Our room had a formal dining area, and we had breakfast delivered to the room. We sat and drank coffee and enjoyed our late check out on Sunday. We also enjoyed the balcony overlooking Brazos St. (at the corner of 6th St.). We are so glad that we chose to stay at the Driskill instead of the W Hotel. The W Hotel is hot and trendy in Austin right now, but it does not have the character, class, and old-school charm of the Driskill.
reviews.title: Brazos Suite for Wedding Night

reviews.text: If you're planning a trip to Austin, you may initially think to book a reservation at the usual hotels. Don't do it! While the W is new and trendy, that's just it. Trendy. Meaning soul-less. And the Four Seasons is fairly classy. Meaning extra pricey. But the Driskill offers both soul and class, in an authentic Western style. It is the oldest operating hotel in Austin, Texas. Each room is uniquely styled and original. The architecture is beautiful Romanesque revival. You just won't find any of that in a chain hotel. Totally worth it. Book WAY in advance to avoid higher rates or a disappointing no vacancy. It's right smack dab in the middle of everything in Downtown Austin and you can walk to all the downtown spots from here, including the bat bridge (Congress Avenue Bridge) that crosses over Lady Bird Lake, 6th Street, the Capitol, and great dining both in house and just down Congress. Don't miss out on this one.
reviews.title: Driskill Hotel is unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed just one night here. The preservation and restoration of this landmark hotel impressed me! Super lovely front desk staff, quick check in. We had excellent martinis at the big bar, very nice bartenders, live music, although the crowd was a little cheesy and there was definitely the drunk convention contingent in there! Our room wasn't huge, but with very high ceilings and all of the modern touches one expects. My one gripe: synthetic lumpy pillows and slimy cotton blend sheets. The bed itself seemed comfortable, but the linens were awful! Lots of history has been preserved and it's a cool mix of old and new. This hotel is right in the middle of the never-ending party that is downtown Austin.
reviews.title: 126 years old and looking fabulous

reviews.text: The advantage of staying at the Driskill in Austin? You are in the action. But that is about it. The checkin was suboptimal. We were told when we checked in that our rooms were not ready, and that we would be called within 90 minutes to get in. We never received a call, and waited 4 hours.
reviews.title: Historic Low Bang for the Buck in Austin

reviews.text: The rooms were nice but very small... Particularly for the exorbitant prices. Lighting in the bathroom was poor. No turndown service. The good part? Excellent car valet service.
reviews.title: Historical hotel In downtown Austin

description: Welcome to The Driskill Hotel. Built in 1886 as the showplace of a cattle baron, The Driskill remains a landmark of legendary Texas hospitality. Located on Sixth Street in the heart of downtown Austin, the luxurious, historic hotel is convenient to all that the city has to offer, including the Texas State Capitol, convention center, opera, symphony, fine dining, shopping, and Austin's 6th Street music scene. Known as the "Live Music Capital of the World,®" Austin is home to nearly 200 music venues, many within walking distance of The Driskill.
